title: How to start my own ISP and start to provide a broadband service in my area - Quora

response.answer_text: By assuming that the question is based on Indian requirement, the below is written. To start the ISP service you need to by the bandwidth from any service provider like Airtel/ Reliance etc. Then you need to take an ISP license from Department of Telecom (DoT) by applying for that. The qualification to apply for ISP is to be a registered company with clearly mentioning the "internet service" as one of the purpose of the company in its Articles of Association. There are three type of ISP licenses now. Cat "A, B & C". Category A gives permission for the entire country operation. Cat B for a telecom circle and Cat C for a city/town.  You may find more information with  data service on www.dot. gov.in.

Own ISP procedure is in www.dot.gov.in Then, register yourself with telecom and start your business. Another option get leased line from private / other ISP and do the business. In this type your investment will be less and support will be more.
